fields.description:
Below are the current lists of changes for the next batch of euca2ools releases.  As more changes occur I will update this issue's description as needed.

Euca2ools 3.2.3 is the last planned 3.2 release.

h4. Changes in euca2ools 3.4.0, 3.3.2, and 3.2.3
* A compatibility issue with Requests 2.11 has been addressed.
* euca-modify-instance-attribute can now delete instances' user-data.  (TOOLS-647)
* euca-import-instance now sends user-data to the server correctly.  (TOOLS-646)
* euca-run-instances's --associate-public-ip-address option now works against default VPCs.  (TOOLS-639)
* euform-validate-template now outputs capability reasons correctly.  (TOOLS-625)
* {{euare-accountlistpolicies -v}} no longer fails when using credentials originating from euca2ools.ini files.  (TOOLS-651)
* euca-bundle-vol now detects the type of partition table of the disk the root filesystem resides on significantly more reliably.
* euca-bundle-vol no longer fails due to UUID conflicts when used on XFS filesystems.  (TOOLS-564)

h4. Changes in euca2ools 3.4.0 and 3.3.2
* euare-assumerole no longer generates invalid session names when run against AWS.  (TOOLS-655)
* The configuration file for AWS now includes the us-east-2, ca-central-1, ap-south-1, and ap-northeast-2 regions.  (TOOLS-661, TOOLS-670)
* When run against Eucalyptus, euca-bundle-vol now automatically retrieves cloud certificates in the same manner as euca-bundle-image.  (TOOLS-633)

h4. Changes in euca2ools 3.4.0
* Euca2ools 3.4.0 requires newer minimum versions of the following libraries:
** requestbuilder 0.6
** six 1.8
* euca-describe-instance-type and euca-modify-instance-type now support VPC network interface limits.  (TOOLS-614)
* euca-associate-address has a new --no-allow-reassociation option that explicitly prevents an address that is in use from being reassociated with another network interface.
* euca-describe-instances now displays instance IDs as part of VPC network interface attachments.  (TOOLS-610)
* It is now possible to view attributes of a CloudFormation template, such as its parameters, without creating a stack using the new euform-get-template-summary command.  (TOOLS-607)
* It is now possible to create and manage VPC NAT gateways using the new euca-create-nat-gateway, euca-delete-nat-gateway, and euca-describe-nat-gateway commands.  (TOOLS-640, TOOLS-641, TOOLS-642)
* euca-create-route and euca-describe-routes now support NAT gateways.  (TOOLS-643, TOOLS-644)
* The new euare-getcallerid command makes it possible to request the ARN, account number, and other relevant information about the currently active set of access keys.
* euform-update-stack no longer requires one to supply it with a template.  When no template is specified, the CloudFormation service will reuse the existing template.  (TOOLS-650)
* Specifying a user name using the AWS_DEFAULT_REGION environment variables can break third party clients that do not recognize that syntax.  To work around this, use the new EUCA_DEFAULT_REGION environment variable instead.  When specified, this will take precedence over AWS_DEFAULT_REGION.  (TOOLS-604)
* euscale-describe-launch-configs now includes user-data in the detailed output it displays when given the --show-long option.  (TOOLS-584)
* euca-describe-subnets now supports the {{cidr}} and {{cidrBlock}} filters.  These function identically to the {{cidr-block}} filter that already existed.  (TOOLS-546)
* The following new commands add support for managing OpenID Connect providers' integration with Eucalyptus and AWS (TOOLS-653):
** euare-oidcprovideraddclientid
** euare-oidcproviderchangethumbprint
** euare-oidcprovidercreate
** euare-oidcproviderdel
** euare-oidcproviderdelclientid
** euare-oidcprovidergetattribute
** euare-oidcproviderlist
* For CloudFormation template parameters with restrictions on allowed values, euform-get-template-summary now displays these allowed values.  (TOOLS-660)
* It is now possible to retry a failed CloudFormation rollback operation using the new euform-continue-rollback command.  (TOOLS-637)
* euca-describe-route-tables now prefers to display network interface IDs to instance IDs when displaying routes that point to instances' network interfaces.  (TOOLS-634)
* The default configuration for euca-bundle-vol now excludes the following directories in addition to those it excluded in previous releases.  To customize this behavior, edit /etc/euca2ools/bundle-vol/excludes or use the {{--no-filter}} command line option.
** /run
** /tmp
** /var/cache
** /var/run
** /var/tmp
* euare commands that output euca2ools.ini files will replicate the {{verify-ssl}} option in its output if that option is set.  (TOOLS-631)
* euca-bundle-image no longer fails with an authorization error when IAM policy prevents it from automatically retrieving cloud certificates.  This will not prevent euca-bundle-image from failing; to resolve the issue, obtain an IAM policy that permits the {{euserv:DescribeServiceCertificates}} operation or supply the cloud's certificate using the {{--ec2cert}} command line option or the {{cert}} region option in euca2ools.ini.  (TOOLS-630)
* euwatch-put-data now supports reporting multiple metric data in a single invocation using the {{-v}} or {{-s}} options multiple times.  (TOOLS-612)
* euwatch-put-data's {{-s}} option now accepts arbitrary attributes for metric data, making it possible to report data for multiple metrics or timestamps in a single invocation.  See the command's documentation for additional details.  The long name for {{-s}} is now {{\-\-metric-datum}}.  Its previous name, {{\-\-statistic-values}}, continues to function as it did in previous releases.
fields.summary: Change list for euca2ools 3.2.3, 3.3.2, 3.4.0

comments.body: * Added a bug number to the issue for TOOLS-614

[~gholms] do you have ticket # for the following entries, please:
* A compatibility issue with Requests 2.11 has been addressed.
* euca-associate-address has a new --no-allow-reassociation option that explicitly prevents an address that is in use from being reassociated with another network interface.
* The new euare-getcallerid command makes it possible to request the ARN, account number, and other relevant information about the currently active set of access keys.

[~gholms] please review:
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/maint-4.3/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_index_3.2.3.html
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/maint-4.3/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_index_3.3.2.html
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/maint-4.3/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_index_3.4.0.html

Notes:
# There are placeholders that need updates (e.g., TOOLS-nnn).
# There are 3 sections under each release heading.
# Known Issues sections (3) need review and update.
# Let me know if there are any removed/deprecated features.
# See comment above for a few bullet items you provided w/o ticket #s.
# Version with id '3.2.3' does not exist in JIRA.
[~gholms] forgot to actually _assign_ this ticket to you.

for #1 above - per [~gholms] - The ones with "TOOLS-nnn" do not have JIRA issues associated with them. They usually are from a patch / PR. So can remove "TOOLS-nnn" placeholders. 

More DOC tickets need to be filed for changes to commands, e.g., very updated command: euwatch-put-data Note to self: euwatch-put-data doc should have XREF to EUCA CloudWatch docs: http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/maint-4.3/#user-guide/monitoring_metric_ref.html

http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/maint-4.3/#euca2ools-guide/euwatch-put-data.html ... added DOC-2039

The "What's New?" page for 3.3.2 contains a placeholder row for removed features that probably just needs removing.  TOOLS-518 still affects all euca2ools releases.  Everything else looks great.  Thanks!

Here is the second, and hopefully last, batch of changes:

h5. Changes in euca2ools 3.4.0, 3.3.2, and 3.2.3
* {{euare-accountlistpolicies -v}} no longer fails when using credentials originating from euca2ools.ini files.  (TOOLS-651)
* euca-bundle-vol now detects the type of partition table of the disk the root filesystem resides on significantly more reliably.
* euca-bundle-vol no longer fails due to UUID conflicts when used on XFS filesystems.  (TOOLS-564)

h5. Changes in euca2ools 3.4.0 and 3.3.2
* When run against Eucalyptus, euca-bundle-vol now automatically retrieves cloud certificates in the same manner as euca-bundle-image.  (TOOLS-633)
* The configuration file for AWS now supports the ca-central-1 region.  (TOOLS-670)
** Editor's note:  I recommend combining this with the release note for TOOLS-661.

h5. Changes in euca2ools 3.4.0
* Euca2ools 3.4.0 requires newer minimum versions of the following libraries:
** requestbuilder 0.6
** six 1.8
* For CloudFormation template parameters with restrictions on allowed values, euform-get-template-summary now displays these allowed values.  (TOOLS-660)
* It is now possible to retry a failed CloudFormation rollback operation using the new euform-continue-rollback command.  (TOOLS-637)
* euca-describe-route-tables now prefers to display network interface IDs to instance IDs when displaying routes that point to instances' network interfaces.  (TOOLS-634)
* The default configuration for euca-bundle-vol now excludes the following directories in addition to those it excluded in previous releases.  To customize this behavior, edit /etc/euca2ools/bundle-vol/excludes or use the {{--no-filter}} command line option.
** /run
** /tmp
** /var/cache
** /var/run
** /var/tmp
* euare commands that output euca2ools.ini files will replicate the {{verify-ssl}} option in its output if that option is set.  (TOOLS-631)
* euca-bundle-image no longer fails with an authorization error when IAM policy prevents it from automatically retrieving cloud certificates.  This will not prevent euca-bundle-image from failing; to resolve the issue, obtain an IAM policy that permits the {{euserv:DescribeServiceCertificates}} operation or supply the cloud's certificate using the {{--ec2cert}} command line option or the {{cert}} region option in euca2ools.ini.  (TOOLS-630)
* euwatch-put-data now supports reporting multiple metric data in a single invocation using the {{-v}} or {{-s}} options multiple times.  (TOOLS-612)
* euwatch-put-data's {{-s}} option now accepts arbitrary attributes for metric data, making it possible to report data for multiple metrics or timestamps in a single invocation.  See the command's documentation for additional details.  The long name for {{-s}} is now {{\-\-metric-datum}}.  Its previous name, {{\-\-statistic-values}}, continues to function as it did in previous releases.

[~gholms] just double-checking that I got all the right issues in the right places ... please take a look also. thanks 
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/maint-4.3/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_index_3.4.0.html
